headline: Best Meatloaf
description: This is the best meatloaf recipe ever: moist and tender on the inside with a yummy glaze on top. This recipe can easily be modified to your taste.

video.description: The baked fish in this recipe video is a "no-smell" fish recipe. Take foil packets to the table for service, and keep the packets around for wrapping and discarding bones and skin. Then when dinner is done just drop it in the trash.
video.name: How to Make the Best Meatloaf

name: Best Meatloaf

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Gather all ingredients.
Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat, and cook onion and garlic until onion is soft and translucent, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat, and season with salt and pepper.

Combine onion and garlic mixture, beef, crumbled bread, crushed crackers, egg, sour cream, Worcestershire sauce, and 1/2 can tomato sauce in a large bowl. Mix until well combined. Gradually stir in milk, 1 teaspoon at a time, until mixture is moist, but not soggy.
Transfer the mixture to a 5x9-inch loaf pan.

Bake uncovered in the preheated oven for 40 minutes. Increase oven temperature to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Continue baking 15 minutes, to an internal temperature of 160 degrees F (70 degrees C).
Mix the remaining tomato sauce and ketchup in a small bowl. Pour over the top of the meatloaf, and continue baking for 10 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I gave it three stars because the flavor was pretty good, except I would cut down the salt by 1/4 tsp. The cooking times are off, mine came out a bit raw in the middle. I know she did say that internal temp should be 160 though and that was before it went in for the last 10 mins. After cooking completely, it was still way too soft and fell apart. Not a bad recipe, I‚Äôll keep it for the flavor and just tweak it a tad. I definitely won‚Äôt put the same amount of sauce/milk in the meat next time.

Wow! Congrats on a great recipe and a great video too! I I have made this meatloaf 3 times since you posted on allrecipes dot com and can offer a few suggestions- 1. try using beef labeled as just ground beef instead of ground sirloin or ground chuck. Me thinks that somehow the meat loaf tasted even better when I used plain lean ground beef! I will contact Alton Brown for an explanation about this! LOL!; 2. try adding 1 cup of pre-cooked and diced Spam to the recipe! Yes, that Spam! And hold the salt, you will not need it! LOL!; 3. add the zest of 1 large orange and 1/2 cup of your favorite BBQ Sauce to the recipe for the glaze! Now please report back about how you like my suggestions (or not!). Happy cooking!
Best meatloaf ever!

It was moist and tasty. I made two and am looking forward to having it for a quick dinner in the future. Did not add milk or sour cream. Used half turkey half beef. Also used 3/4 Cup Italian Bread Crumbs in place of bread and crackers. Definitely will make again.
Very tasty! I added chopped carrots too. Moist and flavorful.

This meatloaf came out perfect. Very tasty, juicy, tender yet retained it's shape to be able to cut and serve. I used three different chopped meats and did not use crackers. Saved recipe to make again.

Moist and delicious. Cooked in a meatloaf pan with a raised bottom that prevented it from sitting in grease and drippings which prevented it from being soggy. For southern tastes, added about a quarter cup of brown sugar and several tablespoons of yellow mustard to the glaze for that sweet twang.
Substituted spaghetti sauce for tomato paste

Before starting, I noticed that the video at right does not follow the baking instructions. The glaze is put on when the temperature is increased for the final minutes. It doesn't show anything about the middle phase. That being said, I followed the video and put the glaze on for the final 15 minutes @ 400¬∞. I am also trying to eat more vegetable-forward, so I prepared this with 1 lb ground beef and 1 lb ground meat substitute. It worked great, wasn't greasy and had a meaty texture. Could have used a bit more salt b/c of the substitute, but I prefer to let people salt their own food anyway. Otherwise, because we like it spicy I added horseradish to both the loaf and the glaze. I didn't have the whole quantity of sour cream called for. Didn't seem to matter ‚Äî no issues with dryness, and I didn't add the milk. Overall very tasty and not time-consuming.
I have made meatloaf for many years but thought I'd try this one. OMG! It is fabulous! My husband loves it and want me to make more soon. Thank you.

It was very delicious my family loved it so much. I did however did not mix the tomato sauce with the catsup at the end i just rubbed catsup on top and I di not use the sour cream and did add some garlic with cheese seasoning on the bread. thank you very much for sharing your recipe.

Really delicious meat loaf and will be making it again soon. I didn't have any lean ground beef on hand, but I did have a pound of 80/20 and a pound of ground pork. So, this was a little fatty but the flavor was incredible. I used 3/4 cup of Progresso Garlic & Herb bread crumbs instead of bread and crackers. I'm not a huge fan of tomato sauce, so my glaze was about 3 parts ketchup to 1 part tomato sauce. Everything else was just as written in the recipe.
This recipe is delicious. I used fresh ground turkey and swapped marinara for ketchup, stuffed with fresh mozzarella and we were pleasantly surprised !

Can you believe the ingredients to make a simple meatloaf like this costs almost $37.00 today... Yeesh! Anyways... I was going to ask if you can substitute crushed-up cornflakes and a dash of Lowery's season salt for the crackers and bread crumbs... but I'm going to try it anyways and come back with the result. Haven't tried your recipe yet but I will when I have all the ingredients on hand.
It came out great! used bread crumbs in place of the bread and crackers, and added 1/2 a Tablespoon in the sauce.

Great recipe and easy to make. I did the full time cooking and some came out fully well done and some medium rare. I like my steak and burgers that way and it was perfect! I accidentally added 1.5 tbsp of steak sauce and didn‚Äôt end up needing the milk. Thanks for posting!
The salt overpowered the meal. If I tried it again I wouldn't add the salt before cooking but would add as needed at my plate portion.

All I can say is delicious! I didn't have meatloaf seasoning on hand so I found this recipe. Like others I used bread crumbs instead of bread and crackers and didn't have to use milk, since it was already moist. I did increase the ketchup in the tomato sauce since I like more of a ketchup taste versus tomato taste on the top. I will use this recipe instead of using the meatloaf packet from now on. Thanks for posting. ‚ù§Ô∏è
Love love love this Recipe, we cook out meat Before mixing everything and cooking, it makes it BETTER and less greasy
Yummm! I give it a 10 for ease of mixing ingredients and taste is like Mama use to make. Thanks for helping out a dad in need!
Used Kinders Roasted Garlic BBQ sauce on the last 10 minutes instead of catsup and tomato sauce. Never any leftovers here!
Great recipe to build from. I took the advice of other reviewers and added Italian seasoning, also added oregano, minced carrot, minced celery, extra black peoper. I will definitely make again.
I left a few things out but I came out great.
It wasn't bad but just didn't have the flavor I am looking for in a great meatloaf

I've been using this recipe for a few years now. My kids, who never loved meatloaf, love thisüëç. It's one of a very few recipes that I follow pretty much exactly. The only variation depends on the size of the slices of bread I'm using. I must say this is truly "the best meatloaf ever"! üëèüëèüëè
This recipe is very good. The only thing I did different was I used Panko bread crumbs in place of the bread. My husband said it was definitely a keeper.

I have been making the same meatloaf for nearly 30 years because nothing ever came close to mine... Until now! This is absolutely delicious. I followed it almost exactly, but because I changed the scale (for serving size) I had to adjust a little. The only thing I added was extra sauteed onion, extra Ritz crackers and ground sage. My husband couldn't get enough of this meatloaf. He actually asked me to replace my old recipe with this one! Also, I didn't use the topping in this recipe, I used my traditional Ketchup, brown sugar and worcestershire sauce. *sidenote: I never use all ground beef in meatloaf, I use half extra lean ground beef and half ground pork! I think it gives any meatloaf a better flavor!
I used 3/4 cup of quick cooking oats instead of crackers. Leftover freezes well in individual serving size.
I should have used more bread crumbs I didn't use the slice bread and I used nature season instead of salt and pepper but still turned out good taste pretty good and saving this recipe

Since we are not great tomato sauce fans with meat loaf and not so much breading, I added less crumbs, and cream of mushroom soup over the meatloaf instead of the tomato sauce. So good and makes a great gravy.

I always stuck with my tried and true Meatloaf recipe as I've loved it ever since I was a kid and my Mom made it. I decided to try a new recipe to see what other Meatloaf's taste like. This is toe to toe with my recipe. I love the addition of the sour cream. I also loved it the next day as a Meatloaf sandwich. I will definitely be alternating this recipe with my recipe when I make future Meatloaf's.

I got lucky & spied traditional meatloaf mix of equal parts beef, veal & pork at a nationwide chain we actually have. Thought I'd died & gone to meatloaf heaven as we rarely can procure veal in our rural city! Followed recipe with these changes to ensure my family would love this & due to the fact that with at least 20 cans of various tomato products in the pantry...1... lonely.... 7 oz. can of tomato sauce :-( . Subbed 1/2 can crushed tomatoes in the meat mix, reserving the canned sauce for the topping. Added about 1 T. cholula to the glaze as we like a bit of kick. Free formed the loaf, layered fat-trimmed bacon (to reduce fat a wee bit) over the top then surrounded it with fresh carrots, cut into 2-3" pieces. Glazed the carrots as well with the yummy. Checked internal temp with instant read thermometer 5 minutes prior to time recommendation-a perfect 160 degrees.

I only had 1# beef and 1/2# of pork so I had a little different beginning ingredients . Used half a smaller can of tomato sauce and no milk. It was very good. You need to cook this in a loaf pan for sure. Very juicy and delicious. I added a few crazy things to the top sauce. Big squirt Gochujang, 2 teaspoons cumin and 2 teaspoon of soy sauce. Maybe it was because I was drinking some wine. Lol. It was really good. My husband loved it too. I served it with roasted potatoes, carrots and fennel. Yum
It‚Äôs the best meatloaf ever! I sometimes substitute pasta sauce for the tomato sauce, and it turns out great every time.
It was basic meatloaf. wasn't bad. but was not the best i've ever made.
4.5 stars. Made it step for step. Easy peasy. Pretty moist. Thanks for sharing. My 2nd choice behind Matt's Best Meatloaf ever recipe.
The Recipe was very easy to follow and the dish came out perfect and taste delicious see for yourself.
Delicious üíó
Too salty

This meatloaf is so fluffy and good. I think lightly whisking the egg and adding the sour cream or youghurt is the key ! I used youghurt instead of sour cream, added more spice, (italian seasoning, mustard, tapatio hot sauce, and turmeric), and skipped the ketchup and crackers. I made mine with less lean burger so got a nice caramelized layer at the bottom. Thank You for this great recipe!!!
Not sure what is going on but I made this following recipe and it‚Äôs been an hour and it‚Äôs not cooked all the way. The oven is accurate. It‚Äôs very moist and pink.
It was actually the best meatloaf I have ever made... Thank you! Cooking the onion and garlic first is a game changer for me. So good!

This is a one-in-a-million recipe for meatloaf. I'm always on a journey to find THE meatloaf recipe. I've found it! 

I even screwed it up a little bit and had to use onion power and garlice powder instead of fresh (didn't have the fresh) but followed the recipe with adjustments for these ingredients. 

I also read the recipe wrong and put in the full amount of tomato sauce into the meatloaf itself. And, I baked it for an hour on 350 instead of 350 down to 400 degrees. 

IT STILL turned out wonderful. Thank you for sharing this gourmet miracle!!!!
If it's covered with ketchup I hate it.
This was a solid recipe. The sour cream and the tomato sauce made it very moist. My son gave me the head nod which means GOOD.

Really delicious. Followed recipe almost exactly ... I just added a pinch of dried thyme to the meat mixture and a couple of tablespoons of brown sugar to the tomato sauce/catsup mixture. I had to bake it about 30 minutes longer than stated to reach 160¬∞, but that helped caramelize the topping. Definitely recommend this recipe.
I made sandwiches with this meatloaf recipe, fantastic!
Best ever! All my family loved it!!

I don't really like meatloaf, but my mom loves it. It is no surprise, then, that my vote runs toward "meh" and hers toward "delectable". I didn't add any milk and thought that it was too moist without it. As other reviewers have said, there was a TON of grease/liquid in the pan. I probably could have used more buttery, round crackers. I won't make it again.
Delicious. Can‚Äôt wait to make it again.

My family LOVED this!!! 
I made some substitutions, I didn't have a few things; Italian bread crumbs for toast, salsa for tomato sauce, and I topped with Tangy Meatloaf Sauce from this site. My daughter ate almost half in one sitting...and she's not a big girl. Please DON'T try this recipe, I want to keep it a secret, no, I'm only joking! 
It's the best meatloaf I'VE every made also!!!
So good my family has requested I make it again and my boys aren‚Äôt a fan of meatloaf.
very good meatloaf.

I‚Äôve made this recipe several times now. I can‚Äôt believe I‚Äôm just now reviewing it. 

This meatloaf is incredible. It is truly the best I‚Äôve ever had. The only modification I make it that I toast up panko Instead of slices of bread. 

I also double the recipe for meatloaf sandwiches. Droool.

i made exactly like the recipe, i didnt add the milk since it was optional, it held together well, but it was flavorless, needed maybe double the spices, especially the salt. didnt see the need for all those different ingrediants, it was a plain tasting meatloaf, even the topping i would have just done with plane ketchup.would i make again, nope, not worth it...
if you replace the bread and crackers with 2 cups of panko it will save you time
This was a very good meatloaf! Didn‚Äôt have all the ingredients had to substitute a few and it was still good!
Delicious!!!

I usually don‚Äôt add so much tomato sauce. What I do is mix tomato sauce with barbecue sauce. A ratio of one quarter cup of tomato sauce to three teaspoons of barbecue depending on how big meatloaf is. I add bread soaked in milk and breadcrumbs Italian, onions , peppers, garlic minced, onion powder, pepper , egg, parseley, worstershire sauce. The onion I grate. Then pour the tomato sauce and barbecue over to before putting in oven. I love my meatloaf tender and well seasoned. So to each his own. They‚Äôre all good.
This recipe really worked for me. It was absolutely delicious.

Awful - totally bland. I make really good meatloaf but I thought I'd try something different. I didn't add all the milk but usually my family goes back for seconds. No one did - the tomato sauce on top, even with a little ketchup in it was really bad. But the worst part is it had no flavor.
I've been hunting for a good meatloaf recipe for a long time. This is it!

I made this meatloaf and my fianc√© practically swooned! It was so tender and moist.. so flavorful. I added two tablespoons of brown sugar and two spoons of Worcestershire for the glaze. Fianc√© says ‚Äúheaven on earth‚Äù. Thank you for sharing it! ??
Just as easy as could be. Wonderful meal.
I made the recipe exactly as written. Very delicious. I did not need to add any milk as it was plenty moist. Nice flavor and texture. I will definitely make again.

I've tried several meatloaf recipes. They always came out to dry or not a great flavor. My fiancee is a meat & potatos kind of guy so thought i'd try this to make him a good ol fashion comfort food dinner. This has a great flavor & is very moist. I omitted the milk because it was already very moist. It was so good, fiancee stamp of approval!

First meatloaf I‚Äôve made completely on my own. Pretty good...nice and moist, albeit a little fragile.
My mom told me put a little water and olive oil in the casserole pan because I guess that‚Äôs always the way she made it. But, she is the type who insists on really blazing the meat and cooks usually to the point of dryness. I followed this recipe as written. My tip is: I think you can skip the water and oil. Unless you lambast your meat too. 
The end result, again, not bad, but I had quite the pool in the bottom of my casserole. I drained off as much as I could after I transferred it onto a serving platter. I even made beef gravy to go with this, but that probably wasn‚Äôt necessary.
Absolutely excellent.

Really good recipe. I increased the onion and garlic. Also just used the toasted bread - and no crackers, but made toast with garlic butter on it. I don't think the milk is needed. Consistency was great without adding it.
I made it according to the directions. I think next time I will use bread crumbs or cracker crumbs. Otherwise everyone liked it. It's difficult to please my son, but he ate two helpings.

My husband is not a fan of meatloaf due to prior ‚Äúdry‚Äù experiences. However, I made this and it didn‚Äôt last long enough to take a picture - D-E-L-I-C-I-O-U-S - this will be my go to meatloaf recipe from now on.
Husband raved and he‚Äôs not a fan of meatloaf like we all are! Followed the recipe to the T. Wouldn‚Äôt change a thing

I‚Äôve made several times and LOVE this recipe. I do have to adjust for gluten sensitivity. So I just use 1/4 cup of gf bread crumbs, which has worked well. I do have to add that no matter how many meatloaf recipes I‚Äôve made, I always substitute the ketchup for my favorite BBQ sauce.
I made it and have a lot more sauce, because we love sauce over our rice

My husband has been pestering me for meatloaf for years. I finally gave in after reading the reviews on this recipe. It truly was VERY good - some of the best I've had. I didn't add as much milk as the recipe called for (I really just "eyeballed it" until the mixture looked moist enough) and instead of topping with the leftover tomato sauce, I did a mixture of BBQ and brown sugar. I think I would put BBQ in it next time instead of the tomato sauce. I think it would also be great with some bacon on top! Overall, great recipe. Will make again.
Great recipe. Allrecipes is my all time favorite site because they do not spend 20 pages of pictures and bios before finding the recipe.

Easy to make; delicious aromas begin while mixing the onion, garlic, worchestershire sauce and continue through the cooking. 
Delicious, tender and goes well with pasta, potatoes or rice...side dish of fresh greens.
Great for "sammies" the next day!

This meatloaf is fantastic! I only needed enough for 2 people so I halved everything. I used Panko breadcrumbs instead of bread and crackers. I added a dash of Italian seasoning. I didn‚Äôt need the milk. I made a glaze for the top with 1/4 cup ketchup, 2 TBSP brown sugar and 1 1/2 TBSP white vinegar. Definitely a keeper!

This is the best meatloaf I have ever made and I have made many! I would not change a thing. FYI: I did cut down on the prep by using a packet of onion soup mix just because I was late getting into the kitchen. I do prefer fresh ingredients that is why I would stick to the recipe. The onion soup worked well too if you are in a hurry. I just eliminated adding salt as the dry soup mix has it in it. Great recipe! Thank you.

The changes I made were more out of desperation because I did NOT want to go back out in 110¬∞ heat plus the stinging smoke and ashes from one of the many careless fires that is currently inundating California.

I don't eat eggs nor did I have sour creme so I substituted in mayonnaise; it tends to be my "go to" product whenever I am subbing for eggs or in need of a binder.

I did not know that the author of the recipe used milk as an aid to being in high altitude. I am surrounded by hills so it often acts like a convection oven but I have never had to adjust recipes. I used evaporated milk and it gave a depth of flavor and texture, and did not dry it out. I also added a little more catsup and a couple of dashes of red wine vinegar for the sauce to top the loaf during the final 10 minutes of cooking. I also added an additional eight minutes under the broiler to get a slight char to the sauce. Bonus: Roommate says it is the best meatloaf he has ever had!
It turned out very well, though I would prefer to add breadcrumbs vs the toasted bread. Great recipe
Excellent. My family said it is the best meatloaf I,
added a bit of brown sugar to topping ingredients

Having always before made turkey loaf, making a classic meatloaf was something of an adventure for me. I thought of this at the last minute (of course) and picked this recipe because of the personal note to its title "‚Ä¶.I've ever made." Well, not only was it my first, but it was definitely my best ever, and I'll use this as a base recipe from now on.

I made so many changes the author may not wish to claim my version at all, but it came out so well!

First, I used ground sirloin (it's hard to go wrong with sirloin). Second, I had no "store-bought" white bread, so tore up a couple hamburger buns (I NEVER have hamburger buns in the house, but there they were). Third, I had no‚Äîand still have no‚Äîidea what crackers were called for, but just took 6 or 8 Ritz and crushed them into the mix. Fourth, canned tomato sauce sounded too bland, so I used a can of fire-roasted crushed tomatoes with garlic. (Since when can one have too much garlic?) Lastly, I didn't have any Worcestershire, so used some A1 I found after rummaging around in the fridge. Whew! Perhaps we should call this "My Bomb-proof Meatloaf," for despite all of my fudging it came out wonderfully moist and tasty. (I followed the cooking directions exactly.)

In fact, it was so good that I had another large slice around 10:00 pm as a snack! Many thanks for posting this fine guide to Meatloaf! I'm now empowered enough to experiment further and develop a repertoire. But I should imagine I'll always come back to this fine recipe.

Wonderful recipe with a few modifications. 
First I used ground steak meat.
I placed 3 slices of honey wheat bread with butter on both sides. Cook bread until well toasted. Then let it set aside. Then I placed 1/4 Cup of FINELY chopped onion in pan & cooked with butter. As they were almost finished I added (2TBSP) of garlic PASTE(since that‚Äôs the equivalent of two cloves) . As they finished up I estimated a little pepper & salt. Crumbled the toast & egg and mixed into meat. Then added the onion and garlic mix and crackers with 1/2 a can of the tomato sauce. At this point I could tell this recipe didn‚Äôt need anymore moisture. So I then placed in pan and cooked according to the directions. For the sauce I added the same amount of ketchup but I added about 2 tbsp of brown sugar and then poured most on top until meat was covered. Finished cooking and it was an ABSOLUTE hit for my crowd
Amazing Recipe ! This Is My New Go To Meatloaf Recipe ! Might Try Roasted Pueblo Or Hatch Green Chili In Next Batch !

Since I wasn't feeding numerous people, I cut the recipe in half. It was still very tasty. I did end up using chili sauce instead of making the recipe's sauce for the topping because we just like chili sauce. At first, I thought the meat mixture was going to be too moist, but I kept mixing/kneading it, and the bread soaked up the excess. I have a special meat loaf pan (2 pc) that drains the excess fat. It was definitely a hit, and I will make it again.

I never leave reviews, but I had to on this one! I‚Äôve tried countless meatloaf recipes and this was the best! I made a couple of changes, left out tomato sauce (didn‚Äôt have) and added a packet of Lipton onion soup mix. Everything else I did exactly and it was soooo good! My 6 year old had three helpings and is not typically a fan of meat!

This recipe got rave reviews with my family of six. Four of which are not meatloaf fans. I made this for my husband who loves meatloaf and says it is the best he has ever put in his mouth! Considering he has been eating meatloaf 50 years lol, that says alot. So..I omitted the milk, and swapped the bread n crackers for italian breadcrumbs. I added the crumbs as needed until the meat was not too wet. I took another readers advice placing bread underneath, perfect idea. I had no loaf pan since we dont usually do meatloaf, yet it held shape perfectly. The sauce I added brown sugar to, yum. Will double to have more for spooning Timing and temps also perfect. Will make for years to come!! Served it with Sallys Spinach n Cheese Mashed Potatoes recipe on this site!
Is the best meatloaf EVER!!!! Please try it. Yhe only change I did, was the worchesteir suacce , I replace it with my favorite BBQ sauce. Spectacular!!!

Good Saturday morning May 30, 2020, 
The meatloaf was the best I ever made because it's the only one I ever made. We enjoyed the taste. Even though it fell apart - too liquidy although I drained the pan three time. Used Italian bread crumbs. Maybe crackers next time. Really like the adjustment gadget that gave ingredients for two. Lunch today cold meatloaf sandwiches....love 'em. Blessings, Jack 
PS Served with mashed potatoes and green beans....Allrecipes recipes.

By far one of the best meatloaf recipes I‚Äôve ever made! Followed the directions for the most part, I used club crackers and a can of manwich in place of tomato sauce. Made gravy with the drippings. One of my family‚Äôs favorite meals!!

Amazing, moist and a hit with my family. I cut the tomato sauce in half and stuck with my regular ketchup, bbq and brown sugar topping. Also added the onion raw as we like a little crunch. I'll definitely make again!!!!

Terrible. Im in a very dry environment, made exactly as told, 93-7 ground beef, and when i took it out, it was uncooked in some spots and didn‚Äôt hold together. It tasted good where cooked but id not use butter text time unless i had 100% lean.

Easy to make and basic enough that you can add things without ruining it. I added about 1 tbsp of brown sugar to the ketchup/tomato sauce glaze and subbed about 1 tsp of onion powder for the real onions. It was delicious!
Excellent. Cooking the vegetables is key to having a meatloaf without being able to pick out pieces of onion in it.

I love this meatloaf recipe and so do my KIDS! They eat it all every time and always ask for seconds. When make this recipe I cut it in half and never add milk. I find that the milk makes it mushy. I also drain the grease before cutting and serving. Enjoy!
Definitely one of the better ones I‚Äôve had! Skip the milk though unless you live in high altitude.
It turned out amazing... didn‚Äôt change much except i alway put a lil ginger beer in the bottom of pan just for extra moisture. Comes out delicious
